speaker: Male Speaker
narrator_cue: Do you remember how to say, "This evening"?

speaker: Male Speaker
text: À cinq heures, je vais manger.
narrator_cue: Say, "At five o'clock, I'm going to eat."

speaker: Female Speaker
narrator_cue: Say, "Yes, I would like to eat too."

speaker: Male Speaker
text: Est-ce que vous allez boire du vin?
narrator_cue: Ask, "Are you going to drink wine?"

speaker: Female Speaker
text: Non, je vais boire de la bière.
narrator_cue: Say, "No, I'm going to drink beer."

speaker: Male Speaker
text: Je ne vais pas boire aujourd'hui.
narrator_cue: Say, "I'm not going to drink today."

speaker: Male Speaker
text: Aujourd'hui, je vais manger à trois heures.
narrator_cue: Say, "Today, I'm going to eat at three o'clock."

speaker: Male Speaker
narrator_cue: Here's how to ask, "How much?" in French?

speaker: Male Speaker
narrator_cue: As in English, it would be too abrupt to simply say to someone, "How much?" So let's learn a more polite way of asking, "How much do I owe you?"

speaker: Male Speaker
text: Je vous dois combien, s'il vous plaît?

speaker: Male Speaker
narrator_cue: Ask, "How much do I owe you today?"

speaker: Male Speaker
narrator_cue: Here is how to say "eleven francs."

speaker: Male Speaker
text: Est-ce que je vous dois cinq francs?
narrator_cue: Ask, "Do I owe you five francs?"

speaker: Male Speaker
text: Est-ce que je vous dois douze francs?
narrator_cue: Ask, "Do I owe you twelve francs?"

speaker: Male Speaker
narrator_cue: Do you remember how to say "one franc"?
